title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It is in Three parts- phone screening, panel interview with five people via zoom, if selected after this, you go to an in person last interview and tour of the college.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where someone did not agree with the design that you made for them Erin, include how you communicated and made them happy.

title: Network Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: applied online, contacted by HR, took about 3 weeks. Was interviewed by 7 people, like do these people not really have anything to do! I've interviewed at amazon and for police departments and this was the toughest interview I've ever been in, for frankly a job that wasn't really that great. The CIO was actually a bit condescending, I got the impression that it may have been a somewhat tense work environment. Most of the questions were skill based, I have some skills that matched the description, but it became obvious that they were actually looking for a CCNA, which you can hire for a much lower wage than what they were advertising.  I was asked to fill out a skills survey, again a first for me ever, I've heard of skills testing but generally hiring managers and HR reps can get a good feel of your background with a skills test or a resume. The CIO seemed a bit obsessed with this survey that didn't really seem relevant to the position.  HR reps were completely professional and very accommodating.
Interview Questions: If you are selected, when can you start? Cmon man nobody is falling for that question.

title: Reader/Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first thing I noticed is the campus is stuck in the 90's.  And basically that it needs a makeover. Also, when I asked about hours, I was told that I couldn't been given a firm schedule.  I get that is part time job, but I need work.  Plus, I don't drive and it seems that the commute would not be good and it didn't seem that would pay benefits either.
Interview Questions: No questions as the interview was literary 5 mins.

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Really like that professional manner, HR provided detailed guidance for me on the college campus. I was interviewed by 5 people. They also provided a list of questions, it was way much more comfortable to handle the overall interview process with that list.
Interview Questions: Explain your background experience on this position.

title: Outreach O Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a five-person panel style interview with questions from each faculty member for initial first round interview, then there was a more informal interview with the department head as well as the supervisor for the second round.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you went above and beyond to help someone.

title: Bookstore Buyer Full Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Bellevue, WA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview easily arranged by email.  Actual interview was in person with a panel of 6.  It was fairly relaxed and informative, they took turns asking me questions which were the standard interview type you would expect.
Interview Questions: My favorite place I have travelled.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Renton Technical College
Interview Descriptions: Video interviewed with six members of the staff. I was asked several rounds of questions. Apparently I was supposed to receive those questions ahead of time, but did not. About a week later I received a call that I was selected for an in-person interview and to await the date and time. I was coming from out of state and they wanted to bring me out one time only. A week went by and no call, so I followed-up with a voicemail. Another week, nothing. About a month later, I received a voicemail about the position I "interviewed for" and that they were finalizing their chosen candidate. What a let down.

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
interview from about 8 people from different department
HR, Network engineer, security engineer, IT team.
questioned about project experience, weakness, 5yr goal,
and it took about 1-2hours to finish interview and it was pretty difficult interview
Interview Questions: Please describe any projects you have done

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was really easy and fast interview, the hiring management was so respectful and i really enjoyed it,  my skills was good and was fits the position requirement and I was so confident to answer there questions.

title: Tenure Track Faculty Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Renton Technical College
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a panel of 6 people asking about experience and scenario based questions, 15 minute teaching demonstration. Second interview with the president. Questions were asked by each person, related to student behaviors, curriculum and program development as well as simulation experience.
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you

title: Position In Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Renton Technical College (Renton, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview, then one on one. No reimbursements of travel were offered. A simple quiz preceded the panel interview, containing several questions that were more of an idiot screen than a true understanding of the potential employee.
Interview Questions: Bizarre questions that seemed more aimed at personality than professional experience.

title: Lead Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Renton Technical College
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview of a panel of three, including 2 student. Used as a learning experience for student on both sides of the interview. If panel approves the applicant is then directed to the hiring manager for final follow up interview and orientation.
Interview Questions: Very standard interview questions, meant to be used as learning experience for students on interview panel.
